title-group.article-title: Exchange-Rate Systems, Currency Unions, and Convertibility: Hungary's Prospects

abstract.p: Most of the old truisms concerning exchange-rate systems and currency unions have already found themselves on the "ash heap of history," to cite our old friend, Karl Marx, that inventor of pithy sayings. However, far too few economists have acknowledged this fact until now. Based on the experience of the past fifteen years, we may safely conclude that accepted economic theses concerning exchange-rate systems and currency unions have not proven themselves. Far too long we have been prisoners of biased views, the development of which were influenced by the historical experiences of the interwar period. It was thought that these experiences can be universally applied, whereas the circumstances of the given period were quite unique. In order to form a valid presentation of Hungary's social opportunities, we have to rethink the entire chain of issues.
